issue.title: Simple Note-Taking CLI App
issue.body:
## Overview
Build a simple command-line note-taking app in TypeScript.

## Requirements

### Features
1. Add a note with title and content
2. List all notes
3. Delete a note by ID
4. Search notes by keyword

### Technical
- TypeScript
- Store notes in a JSON file (notes.json)
- Use commander.js for CLI parsing
- Simple and clean code

### Commands
```
notes add --title "My Note" --content "Note content here"
notes list
notes delete --id 1
notes search --keyword "meeting"
```

### File Structure
```
src/
  index.ts    # CLI entry point
  notes.ts    # Note operations
  storage.ts  # JSON file storage
  types.ts    # TypeScript types
```

Keep it simple!

ems.task: Create project foundation with .gitignore, package.json with dependencies (commander, typescript, @types/node), tsconfig.json, and src/ directory structure
ems.error: No workers merged - all had conflicts

ems.task: Implement core data layer: Note TypeScript interface, JSON file storage operations (read/write notes.json), and note CRUD logic

workers.task: Create Note TypeScript interface and storage layer. Define Note interface with id, title, content, and createdAt fields in src/types.ts. Create src/storage.ts with readNotes() and writeNotes() functions that handle JSON file operations for notes.json

Implement note CRUD operations in src/notes.ts. Create addNote(title, content), listNotes(), deleteNote(id), and searchNotes(keyword) functions that use storage layer to read/write notes and generate unique IDs

Create CLI entry point in src/index.ts using commander.js. Implement commands: add (with --title and --content flags), list, delete (with --id flag), and search (with --keyword flag). Wire up commands to functions in notes.ts

ems.task: Build CLI interface with commander.js for all commands (add, list, delete, search) with proper argument parsing and user-friendly output

workers.task: Create types.ts with TypeScript interfaces for Note type (id, title, content, createdAt) and NotesArray type
Create storage.ts with loadNotes() and saveNotes() functions for reading/writing notes.json file using fs module
Create notes.ts with addNote(), listNotes(), deleteNote(), and searchNotes() functions using the storage functions

analysisSummary: Implement a TypeScript CLI note-taking app with commander.js supporting add, list, delete, and search operations with JSON file storage
